Reviews.Title: “In a residential area on the outskirt of Rome, but manageable for tourists.”
Reviews.Author: MiriamPablo
Reviews.Content: Quite safe residential neighborhood. Decent breakfast. Rooms are clean and bathrooms are modern. Safe is large enough for laptops. Wi-Fi was horribly slow, and I needed fast internet (had some work to turn in during vacation), so I had to purchase a wi-fi subscription (found a cheap plan at a phone shop in Central Station). The hotel is nowhere near the center of Rome, but a metra stop is only 10 minute walk from hotel and there is a 24 hr city bus that stops in front of hotel. I took my 78 year old grandmother for Easter and it was extremely easy and cheap to get around Rome using public transportation. Not far is a laundry mat, several grocery stores, and many local shops. Good value for the money and distance isn't an issue if you're not shy about hopping on the local buses and trains.

Reviews.Title: “Never go there unless you have a car!”
Reviews.Author: Marooka
Reviews.Content: So the facts are, the hotel is clean, rooms are nice, breakfast is ok as a matter of quality but variety isn't that great. Now the problem is the location, if you are a solo traveller without a rented car, never think of going there. You are at least an hour away from Rome Termini (Train station) you have to ride 3 different transports to reach there - bus, tram & a train (Yes a train). Most of the escalators are not working so you have to go all the stairs - i did it with my daugher's stroller. Although the hotel is rated one of the best in rome and it's price was amazing (66 euros), i discovered the reason when i arrived was the location. Other problem is the closet, it has no cover and all your belongings can be seen with house keeping

Reviews.Title: “Good stay”
Reviews.Author: LisaJack
Reviews.Content: Advantages:Lovely staff-ALL OF THEM ARE REALLY NICE and it makes a big difference,easy to park the car,good location,good size bedrooms Disadvantages:Only water in the mini bar,I am quite a regular customer and the qualty of the breakfast was worse than previous years (sometimes items finish before breakfast time is over),security for bedroom keys;I find it strange that you can walk in and request your bedroom key without showing any ID.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon in Rome”
Reviews.Author: raindrop92
Reviews.Content: We had booked another hotel that was horrible, so we just came across this one. It was excellent, the staff were so helpful, breakfast was great. We did have dinner at the hotel too and it was great. Would definately recommend this hotel. It is about 40min by train to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Thriller, crazy Russian women and...happy end.”
Reviews.Author: Svetlana_Jam
Reviews.Content: Frankly speaking I’d like to start with the end: only due to confidence, steadiness, patience and at the same time insistence of Chief Manager Alberto (I apologize to him if I write his name incorrectly) our vacation had a happy end. So, let’s start our story. My sister and I arrived to the Veio Park Hotel on 5th , September. It looked very nice from the road because it is located a bit deep in the private little park (not on the busy road – it is important who likes to sleep in the peace). There is a lot of safety place for car parking in front of the building and at the same time there are a lot of green trees there to make a pleasant shade. The building itself looks very nice and well-conditioned. In the room there are all necessary conveniences including a safe ( it’s important for my story). We left our luggage in the room, placed documents and money into the safe and ran to Rome. Here I’d like to notice that the way to Rome is not so difficult as I had read in tourist sites while I was preparing my trip. 5-10 minutes by bus (201,223 and one more)to La Giustiniana station, then 20 minutes by train to the station Roma St.Peter using the same ticket for 1 Euro. We walked around Rome all day. It was wonderful. In the evening we returned to the hotel, asked in the restaurant a teapot with hot water, drank in the room our “Russian tea” and went to sleep. I even couldn’t imagine what the next morning may hold! Next morning we went to have breakfast and I opened the safe to take my money to pay for the hotel. Breakfast and payment took about 20 minutes (breakfast is rather rich and various for Italy). We were hurry because in three hours we should be in the port Chivitavecccia to check in for Mediterranean Cruise. Coming back to the room we started to pack our things and at one moment I’d like to pack my passport and couldn’t find it. At first I wasn’t very nervous thinking that it fell down somewhere but in some minutes I couldn’t find all my money!!!!!At this moment I remembered that before paying for the hotel I took my passport and money from the safe, put money into the passport and went out from the room. We were hurry and I couldn’t remember if I put them into the safe again! At this moment I noticed that the window was opened (we opened it in the morning ourselves and didn’t close it going to have breakfast). Terrible thoughts immediately came to my mind – STOLEN! Panic and horror seized me – in the foreign country without passport, without visa, without money, without Italian language. What is more that made me fully frustrated - my Cruise that I had been preparing for six months might go kaput(( Of course, first of all I rummaged all my and sister’s luggage, I looked under the beds and into the dustbin but nothing….My sister was running around me and screaming “call the Police, call the Police…” I went to the reception and told them about my awful problem. It was so fortunate that Chief Manager Alberto turned out a patience and clever man. He asked me several questions about our morning. In spite of the fact that I was very nervous I noticed that he was very surprised with the event. I was able to recognize that it is the first incident of such kind in this hotel. But I didn’t have any explanation for the mystery – my passport and money disappeared. We returned with Alberto to the room and again checked up all the bags in it. At the same time my sister ran around the hotel and watched all the dustbins looked under the benches hoping that thief took money but threw out my passport (it is usual practice in Russia because they needn’t to have evidences). I wanted nothing besides my passport! The time melted away and with each minutes we were far and far from our Cruise. My sister got tired to run around the hotel and came back to the room. In her hand there was only little lady handbag. I was sure that she checked up it several times. Only wise and insistent Alberto guessed to make her open it. She resentfully opened it and with words “there are only MY docume….” pulled out the transparent envelope with….my passport…..Her passport was in the absolutely even envelope in her bag,too. I didn’t kill my sister and didn’t kiss to the death Alberto only because we were extremely pressed for time and had to run to the train. Only 20-30 minutes more and our dreams about Cruise might be broken down at all! We looked really crazy from our happiness that moment. Certainly I apologized to the staff and now I want to do it again because I suspected of them. My “bad girl” sister also feels guilty towards them and asks excuse. As she explains at first she took her passport from the safe and then she decided to check the safe up, saw “her” passport again ant took it,too. Money was inside and she couldn’t see them…Thanks God, it was found the man who had precise mind at that moment– Alberto. Seriously speaking I fully recommend this hotel, especially who travels by car and wants to have good conveniences for the reasonable price. Those who use public transport should be ready to spend about 30-40 minutes to take Vatican but to save 50 Euros (minimum) per day. I live in Saint Petersburg and every day spend one hour to get my job and one hour to come back home, so 30 minutes couldn’t frighten me:))

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in Italy ? Maybe !”
Reviews.Author: jean k
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel with stunning staff and super rooms to stay as a base to visit Rome. Nothing was too much trouble for anybody and they were as courteous from reception to restaurant to chambermaids. Super breakfast and Italian coffee to order as you like it. A genuine benefit being outside the city of Rome as you get to experience a bit of suburban Rome with a variety of eating houses and you see the price of "Peroni" tumble in comparison to the "rip off" around Vatican city.

Reviews.Title: “Angelone family (Australia)”
Reviews.Author: angelone4
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel well worth the money. Rooms are ample, clean and comfortable. The staff are very friendly and helpful. It is a little out of Rome but the Hotel provides free shuttle to and from the train station and trains are frequent to the centre of Rome.Buffet Breakfast was included in a room with a view.The staff were very willing to adjust our booking to our needs and answer our questions. The hotel also provides a restaurant well worth eating at. When we return to Rome we will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Immaculate hotel with helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: JaninedR
Reviews.Content: Hotel a bit out of the city but good transport links and hotel transport to station. Excellent value for money. Very clean. Helpful staff. Excellent breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “The place where I would return forever!”
Reviews.Author: ralucapopescu
Reviews.Content: Very very nicie hotel, beautiful garden and stunning view from the room's window. Very nice people. Close to Vatican. Relaxing and quiet atmosphere. I would never think about looking for another hotel while in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “everything great except the location and shuttle service”
Reviews.Author: hall5456
Reviews.Content: Getting a last minute package deal was stressful and I was panciking after so many bad reviews of Rome hotels, although I believed only those that had bad experiences were likely to come on and write a bad review - word of mouth is a powerful thing. As such, given the nice things said about this Hotel i decided to risk staying outside Rome. Reviews were fairly accurate and it was a lovely hotel and the staff were fine and as hit and miss as any UK hotel - some were smiley, some were less, but everyone was helpful! The breakfast looks weak, but is actually rather filling, but i do suggest a wider spread of fruits in the morning.The bed in my room (102) was absol;utely amazing - very firm and I felt great in the morning. My main comments are not so much with the hotel, but its location. The reviews on ehre about the trains are misleading. Firstly the shuttle, which is a car and a member of staff coming out to give you a ride, which feltl it's a favour ratehr than service, and only runs between 8-10am and then 6-8 in the evening. However, I enjoyed the walk to the station - 10-15minutes. The train takes 35 minutes to Roma St Pauls, and I timed it, which is 5 minute walk to the Vatican. However, if you want to get around the city, then the metro from Roma Termini is better or if you are prepared to research, you can try get off earlier and catch the metro from another station; this becomes annoying.... The last train is about 9.30, but again this depends where you get on. We didn't try it, but apaprently tehre was a 10.30 train, however there was also a strike the day we wanted to stay late and so we didn't want to risk it as the trains were hit and miss after 5.30 - normal service did not resume! Overall, it was a massive inconvenience, more so than reviews had you believe, but for a 2 Euro round trip per day (I spent 10 altogether), it may seem worth it to some than paying more extortionate prices in the centre. The problem is that you lose out onseeing the city at night unless you ar eprepared to pay for a taxi, or are staying in winter when it gets darker a little earlier. Yes, there is not a lot around the hotel. A few bars, and a nice restaurant called La giustiniana near the station.It was cheap and cheerful and i thought the food was lovely. The hotel restaurant would definitley be something to avoid - over-priced, for convenience i assume, and really poor quantity to price ratio. It wasn't that nice, too! They need to work on this, but the staff were lovely. Overall, the hotel caters more for business trips rather than leisure, but if they made a few simple changes, such as a decent shuttle service to Rome, four a day 2 morning trips and 2 return trips, i think then there would be no reason to not consider this as a future option if we came back. Until then, I will seek elsewhere in rome when i return in March to for the rugby. Finally, if anything spoilt the trip it was the tourists and little to do with the hotel, they were unbearable and I can understand why Italians have such a rude attitude, tourists are just rude, too, although some Italians in the city centre were just blatantly hostile forgetting that people are on holidays! p.s. I had an Italian / Brazilian partner so she spoke the lingo, which is helpful, so perhaps I received a bit more friendliness through association! :)

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, with excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: stayatthisplace
Reviews.Content: Location was not the greatest with regards to restaurants and other off site amenities, however, staff is excellent. Every question answered and concern addressed. Very nice breakfast and nice on site restaurant. Staff was extremely helpful, especially Daniele, and they bent over backward to make sure everything met our expectations. Provided shuttle to the train station, from which all of Rome was accessible. Room was very large by European standards, however, sound proofing could be improved.

Reviews.Title: “Too far away from Rome”
Reviews.Author: HueyGoldCoast
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay at this hotel because we had a car and were worried about driving and parking in Rome. The other reviews are correct that it takes 20 minutes by train to the closest metro station and another 20 min to the centre of Rome. This does not include the trip to the station though and the wait for the next train. At the time we were knew thus and were willing to accept this, but in hindsight we would definitely not stay this far out again, mainly because it does nit feel like you are staying in Rome, but rather some distant characterless suburb. I feel the traffic in Rome is just similar to that if any other large city and even my 70 year old father drove into the city and easily found parking and a great hotel in the Porta Pia area which had a great atmosphere. Finally we were tired one night and as there is not any other restaurant within about 800 metres if the Veio Park we decided to eat at the hotel. It was 8.30 at night and we were the only ones in the restaurant which feels like a large hospital cafeteria. The restaurant manager was the same man who drives he shuttle (car we had to call 3 times from the station and took 40 minutes to pick us up). It won the prize for the worst meal we had in Italy which I guess us why the restaurant was empty. They also only had 1 waitress for about 30 tables, so I suspect they don't expect many customers.

Reviews.Title: “LOOK NO FURTHER - Numero uno a Roma.”
Reviews.Author: michael_snezana
Reviews.Content: As it was our first time in Italy we were a little nervous about finding a suitable hotel for what we needed. Fortunately for us, everything could not have gone better. We arrived at about midnight on the Saturday night and were greeted by reception who were very helpful. All staff speak perfect English and some even helped us with our Italiano. Situated in an ideal position just 900m from La Giustiniana train station, Veio Park Hotel ticks all the boxes for your stay in Rome. It is approximately a 15-20 minute train ride to the city centre and just the perfect distance away to escape the busy city environment. Surrounding the hotel in nearby streets you have supermarkets, cafes, restaurants etc which will come in handy. The in-house Restaurant has an amazing authentic Italian menu with friendly staff to assist. Highly recommended hotel. Had an amazing time. Thank you Rome, we will be back!!

Reviews.Title: “It's a great hotel. Wow..thanks to all hotel staffs...we will be back for sure"”
Reviews.Author: kirantewari
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Vieo Park Hotel during my vacations last week. I visited Athens, Venice & Rome. All the hotels where I stayed were good but Vieo Park was the best, excellent. The staff was very cooperative, very supportive, room/toilet was very clean and testfully arranged. Hotel staff breifed about Rome very nicely, it was a great help. I dont think such facilities are available in Rome at such an affordable cost. I wish all good luck to Veio Park. I will definitely come back there!!

Reviews.Title: “Comfy stay”
Reviews.Author: wakawa14
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel in October of 2009 for my first taste of Rome. I enjoyed it, and appreciated the service provided by the front desk clerks who not only spoke excellent English but were also quite helpful in guiding me to all the sites as a first time visitor to Rome. It was a modern hotel, with large bathrooms. Breakfast was not provided, which would have been helpful. Another downside is that the hotel is located quite far in the surburbs, you have to take 2 trains to get to termini, but if you don't mind that it offers a good neighbourhood feeling.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, practical hotel”
Reviews.Author: TAgran
Reviews.Content: It's a bit off the beaten path, but for the price is very good for budget conscious travelers. Free shuttle to the train station which will take you straight to St. Peter's, so not terribly inconvenient. Good breakfast, very clean room, very large for Rome standards, nice shower and bathroom. We had a triple room. We particularly appreciated the service and wonderful suggestions by one particular man at the front desk (I forgot his name already), but he worked evenings and gave us great eating/activity suggestions every time we asked. Super nice and helpful. Also, prices at the grocery stores/restaurants in that area are A LOT better than what you'd find in the center of Rome, so that helps save money as well.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay again”
Reviews.Author: whistler_arlo
Reviews.Content: Very friendly and helpful front desk staff, great with directions etc Clean and modern rooms and hotel space Lots of parking Good breakfast and cappuccinos Good mini bar rates Only drawback .... Might have thin walls..... Noise travels

Reviews.Title: “more than a 3* hotel”
Reviews.Author: ubeprincess
Reviews.Content: the hotel surpassed it's rating with friendly service, helpful staff and a lovely room. we had the luck of having our own veranda with the room and it's a shame i didn't go with friends or stay longer, i would have made good use of it! no complaints about this hotel whatsoever! highly recommended. my mum and aunt were extremely happy with everything about the place, as was i. didn't use the room service as there are so many places to eat in town but the hotel restaurant does serve scrumptious artichokes! (bit pricey though). it's a bit of a distance from the city centre though - about 40mins total commute, that and the early checkout are my only qualms. since we were there for 3 days this didn't really help but if we were there for a week, it would have been fine. if you want a comfy stay away from the bustle of the city - stay here! lovely stay.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, but terrible location”
Reviews.Author: Neil186338
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice, but we would not advise to stay here as the location is really bad. The reviews saying that it takes 40 mins to go into the city are very misleading, as it took us at least 1 hour 15 mins to get to termini station. Not only this, but you have to first take a bus, then take overground train then take metro. Going home was also a hassle, as trains in Rome frequently get cancelled, so we would have to wait up to 40 mins for a train back to the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant, friendly staff in a clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: rachaelrae44
Reviews.Content: We had not originally planned to book a hotel outside the centre of Rome but it all worked very well. The staff were friendly, helpful and nothing was too much trouble. The hotel was clean and the room was great. There were bus stops virtually outside the hotel to get into Rome, or to get to the train station. Once we got the hang of the transport system, the fact that we were outside the historic centre of Rome was no problem. There was a useful grocery store about 5 minutes walk down the road in which we were able to purchase our lunch every day on the way into town. We would reccomomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: jaws4172
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel! Even though it is about 30mins from the city centre, they offer a free shuttle service to the station in the morning which was very helpful, there are also a few buses that go to the station. We enjoyed the fact that we could escape to the sanctuary of our hotel in the evening after a busy day in rome. The rooms were cleaned every day and the mini bar restocked regularly and the staff were exceptional, helpful, friendly and accomodating. The food in the restaurant was also lovely and the wine was one of a kind! We can not wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: ednagruenblatt
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a bit far from the city centre, which means travel at least 40 minutes to Rome. But it is a nice, clean and friendly service place. The breakfast was fine. The rooms are big enough for a family but the walls are a bit thin so one can hear all the noise from outside.. But else very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful”
Reviews.Author: sydneysears
Reviews.Content: Our stay was easy and relaxing. The hotel is at a nice location whereby you are close enough to the centre of Rome to access it and it’s amenities but far enough away to enjoy a quiet day in. The staff were helpful, accommodating and approachable. The overall service was good. However, no matter how helpful the restaurant staff may appear, the dinner/ evening menu lacked variety and taste. The evening dinning food was not the best. Consider your options before dinning in during the evening. Saying this, I should stress that the breakfast menu was traditional Italian which was nice. The coffee was really good.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, happy hotel”
Reviews.Author: dotsherriff
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I found this hotel really friendly Staff very helpful and all seemed happy in thier work which leads to a wonderful happy relaxing atmosphere, just what you need when on holiday. would go back and highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: GG1986London
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights here and thought it was a lovely hotel. It may be a little far out of the city centre for some people but we enjoyed escaping the city after a day of exploring and it was easy to get to on public transport. The train was very cheap and didn't take too long at all and although the last train back is 10:15ish there is also a night bus starting at midnight which drops you off right outside the hotel. The hotel looks out over beautiful countryside so eating breakfast with a gorgeous view makes it worth the distance from the city. Rooms are spotless and well equipped with everything you could need. Staff are friendly and helpful with good local knowledge and there are even discounts for nearby restaurants which we enjoyed visiting- much more authentic and a lot cheaper than the city centre. Overall a great stay and we would recommend if you're happy to give public transport a go. Only tip would be to double check the train you are on stops at the station for the hotel as we got on a fast train that didn't and had to go back again!

Reviews.Title: “Recommend”
Reviews.Author: Traveller5270
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at this hotel, however not everything was perfect. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The rooms were small, but very clean and the bathrooms were nice. The location was fine as there is a bus stop right out front which takes you to the train. I liked the area a lot. The breakfast was basic, however one needs to take into consideration this is a 3 star, so can't expect a hot breakfast. The staff had recommended we try their restaurant. I typically never eat at a hotel's restaurant, however since the staff were so friendly, I figured I would support the place. The atmosphere was poor, we were given bread from the morning, the salad was not good by any means however my pasta was good. I would not recommend the restaurant unless they take more care. I think you can do much better anywhere else actually. It was the only somewhat unpleasant dining experience I had while in Rome and the only real negative about the hotel. The free wifi was a nice touch, but the connection was awful. At least from our room.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, helpful staff :)”
Reviews.Author: travelbunny1245
Reviews.Content: Well my partner and I stayed in this hotel for a long weekend. When I booked the hotel i didn’t look and see where there hotel actually was in comparison to the centre of Rome, so when i found out that it was a little far out of the way i was apprehensive. BUT i can say that even being a lazy fall out of bed into the colosseum kind of person, where the hotel was couldn’t have affected me less :). It was so easy to get into the centre of Rome and the sights. There was bus stops going both ways straight outside the hotel and there is a free bus shuttle service between the hotel and the local train station somewhere between 8 and 10 in the morning i think and from 6 to 8 at night (times might not be 100% accurate, i can’t remember). The hotel offers the smallest of the three bus tickets for €1 which means you can safely get into Rome without worry on your first day. (you have to stamp the ticket in a yellowy/orange box when you get to the station and then you have 75 minutes from then, it only allows one metro (underground) journey). What we then opted for when we got into town was a 3 day tourist ticket it basically gave us unlimited travel on buses, metro and trains. There is also a night bus (N25) from the centre of Rome which means you can still get back to the hotel without the crazy prices of taxis(we didn’t even need one) The hotel itself was very clean and comfortable; the staff were very helpful and most spoke good English. The room was cleaned everyday of our stay, changing towels and a general clean-up. The showers were powerful and clean. Surprisingly the minibar was very affordable as well. There are safes in the rooms (which you set the code for) and also air conditioning, which in April was helpful I’m assuming the weather is much hotter in the summer months. We didn’t have dinner here but there is a restaurant open from 7:30pm to 10:30pm i think this hotel is definitely worth the travel into town, I read reviews on here before i went saying how far away it was etc but i seriously believe that it isn’t an issue. Say you have a travel party of two and you’re going for three nights. The money that you save (minus the 22€ for 2 bus tickets) staying at this hotel is extremely worth it. There is absolutely nothing bad to say about this hotel apart from i personally didn’t like the breakfast but there was a wide selection of cereals, cold meats, cheese, yogurts, bread and cakes, which my partner woke up especially for. I’m just fussy with food. there is a local takeaway type pizza place with real Italian pizzas for very decent prices just down the road (turn right out of the hotel) also next to that there is a bar type small shop kind of thing, it sells cigarettes cakes crisps drinks etc. which was convenient and a small supermarket next to that.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with good services”
Reviews.Author: magnata602
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very good. The service is very good too. Amazing breakfast and clean rooms. I Just disliked two things: - The hotel is too distant of the center, you should rent a car to go there. The most next train station is about 1 Km. - The internet speed isn't good, but maybe they resolved this problem now.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, just a little far out”
Reviews.Author: mandie_goddard1
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fantastic, couldnt fault it for anything except its location. If you don't mind travelling about 40mins into Rome then you won't have a problem, and the plus side is its so quiet you actually get some sleep. Although be warned the last trains back on weekdays is 10.30pm and 9pm Sundays. Hotel staff were lovely, we were robbed on our first day and they did all they could to help us find the nearest police station. Breakfast- there is more than enough to choose from! There is also a 'shuttle bus' to and from the station which is on demand between 8-10am and in the evenings- although the station is only a 5min walk away.

Reviews.Title: “one of the best hotels i have ever stayed with in italy !”
Reviews.Author: Ruebzahl
Reviews.Content: it takes you about 30 mins from the hotel to the city (FR 3 train to Valle Aurelia) and the connection is great (bus connection from hotel to train station- bus 201 021, can't recall the otherone... or the hotel shuttle service) the rooms are very clean and nicely attired, especially the bathrooms the hotel offers very friendly and polite receptionist, they are also very international breakfast was an adequate standart breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Modern, comfortable, but a bit out of the city”
Reviews.Author: stephietoronto
Reviews.Content: Overall we enjoyed our stay at Veio Park. LOCATION: a bit far from downtown Rome and sites. But it's in a nice residential neighborhood, and there is a supermarket nearby. I think the last train on weekdays was at 10:30 or 11pm, so we feel a bit rushed after dinner in the city to make sure we catch the last train back since dinner in Rome often starts at 8pm and it's not a quick affair. We also had to take a cab to the airport since our flight was early AM, too early for train operation. The taxi was supposed to be a flat rate from the hotel, E$50, but the cab driver on pulling into FCO airport told us they never agreed to any rate and it was E$55. We couldn't argue since we don't speak Italian and didn't understand the conversation that transpired between conciege and driver. HOTEL SERVICE We were charged for an extra drink and the manager on check out did not take it off. It was for 1 beer which was drank by whoever stayed there before us. It was not us and yet they ignored it. Service was polite but that was it. We found our stay in Florence much more charming and genuinely friendly. BREAKFAST Good selection, good coffee and comfortable airy sitting area. INTERNET You have to pay for usage, there is a computer on the ground floor/lobby. ROOMS Newly renovated. Relatively large by European standards, modern, best part of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, Very friendly staff, Would definitely stay over there again”
Reviews.Author: ROME003
Reviews.Content: I and my wife went on a holiday to Rome and stayed at this hotel. Its very easy to commute to from the airport and all the important tourist sites in Rome are very easy to reach via train / metro from the hotel, at the most 20 minutes maximum. Veio Park Hotel is opening its own food place very soon, though it serves a very good breakfast everyday. There are very good places to eat at ten minutes walking distance from the hotel, where you get a 20% discount if you are staying at the hotel. A free shuttle service on demand from the train station to the Hotel, b/w 0800 and 1000 and 1800 to 2000 hrs; though you can easily walk as it takes only ten minutes to do so and the area is also very safe. Overall, a very relaxing place and we both will strongly recommend this hotel to all intended travellers to Rome. Honestly, no faults found, would love to come back. Recommedations: Please provide English news channel even in standard rate rooms

Reviews.Title: “Perfect, Yet very far away from the center of the city”
Reviews.Author: BeirutGurl
Reviews.Content: An Awesome hotel with the greatest staff , a very good cold breakfast, large and clean rooms. Yet its very far from the airport and the city centre. You need 10 minutes to reach the Train station with the Hotel's shuttle . Other than Location, this hotel is great to stay in .

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, very nice and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: atank22
Reviews.Content: Everything was nice and clean. Staff was very friendly!

Reviews.Title: “very good quality-price”
Reviews.Author: Joelle14
Reviews.Content: Good hôtel, recommanded specialy if you travel by car. The station is near the hôtel and you are in the center of Roma in a quater of an hour. So, you avoid the traffic to go in the center of the city. Good quality price. Rooms are clean and quiet. Good service ans nice breakfeast. English and french spoken.

Reviews.Title: “Good location to do a city break”
Reviews.Author: zottel25
Reviews.Content: Good location to do a city break. Good restaurantes around the hotel. Good sevice in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, very good service, rooms are modern and clean, breakfast is among the best we had in Italy”
Reviews.Author: drenth
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed a very good service at Daniele Bruno's Veio Park Hotel. Many thanks for the excellent rooms and breakfast. Receive our compliments and be assured that we recommend your hotel to others. Randy Drenth & Group (48) from Switzerland

Reviews.Title: “excellent value clean and friendly”
Reviews.Author: chwkbc
Reviews.Content: wonderful stop off on our way home. about 30 min to airport and the cleanest hotel ive ever stayed in, the owner is on the premises along with his son, nice to see..great breakfast and excellent restaurant advise which included a 20 percent voucher.this hotel is quiet and we had a great rest before comming home. it really deserves 4 stars.. i will stay again

Reviews.Title: “My entire family all agreed that Veio Park Hotel is one Excellent Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jbaltazar
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel for the price! Very well designed & built with contemporary/modern but elegant look - definitely more than 3-Star. Rooms are just the right size, a little bigger than the average European accomodation and very functional. The incredible breakfast buffet (included) is always the perfect way to start a day. The free parking & free internet were great amenities. But its best amenity of all is the wonderful, service-oriented and incredibly helpful (well-versed in English) staff who made our whole stay a very pleasant experience. Thank you so much for your hospitality! My whole family cannot wait for our next trip to Italy and our next stay at The Veio Park Hotel. Tutto e Bene!!! Grazie!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good value, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: nikuska20
Reviews.Content: We choose to stay in this hotel because of it's price and location on the city fringe so we could park our car for free and not worry about it while in Rome. We didn't find the approx half an hour train ride to be a problem at all. The staff were very helpful and friendly. Breakfast was varied and plentiful. The hotel offers a 20% discount at two nearby restaurants and here we found extremely good service and excellent food at a very good price. The best we had in Rome and a feeling you were eating where the locals ate rather than getting ripped off with all the tourists in central Rome. Good option outside the city.

Reviews.Title: “At last a 3 Star hotel that more than deserved the rating!”
Reviews.Author: pcmaczone
Reviews.Content: Given the other hotels we had stayed at previously I didn't hold out much hope of the Veio Park Hotel being very good. What a wonderful surprise to find it was more than we could have hoped for! It's a newish, modern hotel located about 30-45 minutes from the centre of Rome. There is a railway station near by though with regular trains going into the centre. The hotel runs a free shuttle service to the station at certain times of the day. There is free parking right in front of the hotel, in the actual hotel grounds so you don't have to worry about on street parking. We parked and walked or took the train to where we needed to go. The staff are excellent. Friendly, knowledgeable and very professional. We could not ask for more. The hotel is very clean and quiet and all rooms have air conditioning and double glazing. There is also a safe in each room to keep your valuables in when your out and about. It has a digital combination which you set yourself. Free wi-fi is also available in the rooms and is of good strength, ask at reception for a user name and password. Breakfast was very good, especially in comparison with some hotels we stayed at and it was included in the price, not an expensive extra! The breakfast staff were again excellent and nothing is too much trouble for them. Can't fault the service at all. In conclusion I can highly recommend the Veio Park, especially if your on a motoring holiday as we were. I really cannot find a single fault with this hotel and that's something I don't say often. Give it a try, you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “A clean hotel with very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: buddymuckelchen
Reviews.Content: A quiet hotel, which is 20 minutes away from the city (by car). The room and the bathroom was very clean and the room keeping worked very well. The rooms are very new and in a good condition. The sanitary fitments are also up-to-date. The breakfast was typically italian, there's something for everyone. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The reception was also very nice and friendly. The staff speaks a lot of languages p. e. english, russian, german, french and of course italian. A further advantage is also that the hotel has a lot of parking lots on their site. If you bring your own notebook, you can receive free internet (W-Lan).

Reviews.Title: “Best customer service imaginable!”
Reviews.Author: ljk_10
Reviews.Content: Our experience at the hotel was far beyond what we expected. The staff went far out of their way to make our stay comfortable and a pleasure. They gave us excellent sight-seeing advice and charted out all our travels for us. They anticipated every need we had with a smile. We highly recommend the hotel if you do not need or necessarily want to stay in the centre of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, not so great location!”
Reviews.Author: Anastassia
Reviews.Content: Hotel Veio is really a great hotel! Nice clean rooms, the facility itself is very clean, quite acceptable breakfast! All the staff is very nice and friendly and willing to help any time. However the location is very inconvenient. You should plan to spend at least one hour each way to get to the centre of Rome and back to the hotel. And if you miss the last train, you can only take a bus or a taxi. All in all I would say that it a great hotel for the price. I would certainly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: gorgomugu
Reviews.Content: This hotel is billed as being close to the centre with good trasport links. The nearest train station is a good 40 minutes away by foot and the train to the centre is 1.5 hours. In terms of tourist attractions there is nothing in the gustinianna zone of rome so if you are wanting to see rome this hotel and its location is not a good choice. The rooms have been refurbished recently and were clean however the air conditioning was useless and the noise during the night made it difficult to sleep. There is no restaurant in the hotel and only a very simple breakfast was available, for lunch you are on your own. The staff on the recption were quite rude and overcharged me and another memeber of our group for the room during our stay. I would not recommend this hotel and for the price it would be easy find a better standard closer to the centre of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Refreshing,friendly and relaxing hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Scottie27Dumbarton
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and found the staff to be friendly, helpful and pleasant. The rooms where immaculate and the breakfast was fresh and was replenished regularly for a continental breakfast. The staff assisted us with the best travel advise and with a free drop off at the station. This made it very easy to commute to Rome, and we could even buy the train tickets at reception. What a service. They even kept our luggage so that we could spend our last day in Rome without the added burden of carrying our luggage with us. We would recommend this Hotel for short or long stays and would use this hotel if we visit Rome again in the future. There was only one draw back for us Brits, there was not a kettle in the room for our evening cuppa, but the night staff obliged us by providing us with hot water. Many thanks for a lovely and memorable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Papadopoulou
Reviews.Content: We were absolutely satisfied from our staying in your hotel. The service was excellent, the rooms were luxurious and we are looking forward to visit you again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: HannoverKranich
Reviews.Content: We have spent five nights here in April 2010. Our room was clean, comfortable, quiet and beautiful. The staff was friendly and helpful. We really enjoyed our stay there. If you would like to enjoy the nightlife of Rome the hotel is not recommendable, because the hotel is out of town. It takes 45 min. by bus and metro to the city, but they offer a very charming shuttle service to the metro station.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel. Location good as well.”
Reviews.Author: samrat_m
Reviews.Content: If you are taking the train to Rome, make sure you take a cab after speaking to the hotel reception who can cut you a discount (max price of E30, if can remember correctly). The staff did not give us this info, and we ended up taking the metro rail, then the suburban rail, and then realized that it's not as close (with suitcases) to walk from the train station (La Gustia... something, I forgot) like they said to us! We finally took a cab from this train station. The hotel itself was good, friendly staff, ok breakfast, clean everything. The area was good, which was an important reason for our choice. Rome city is a little far (2 city buses) though, but we were tourists anyway. They did give a ride back to that train station though.

Reviews.Title: “great surroundings,far from the center”
Reviews.Author: marygk
Reviews.Content: the hotel was very nice,clean and had friendly atmosphere. we really enjoy the gardens and view from our room, full of trees and nature arround. the only disadvantage was that the hotel is kind of far from the city center and though the train's last rout was at 10.10 the hotel's evening transfer was from 18.00-20.00. taxi ride is ok if you are four persons ,it cost us about 20euros per ride but on friday there was a lot of traffic and it cost us 45euros. so our only suggestion is to scedule the hotel transfer at nights so as to correspond with the last train.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the $”
Reviews.Author: cjk2010
Reviews.Content: About 20 minutes by train from Rome, this hotel has a nice breakfast and the manager, Albert will give you a ride to the train station to start your day.. The price was great also. There is a grocery store about 2 blocks away for some snacks. The rooms were modern with a comfortable bed and a decent size for Rome. Front desk staff spoke good English and were very helpful at check-in and check-out.

Reviews.Title: “Totaly satisfying and absolutely recommendable”
Reviews.Author: matullitsch
Reviews.Content: This hotel is worth more than 3 stars. A little outside from Rome center but no problem to reach by quick shuttle from hotel to railway station (free). Absolutely calm with comfortable beds, very nice and competent service staff. Perfect for visiting Rome.

Reviews.Title: “I and my wife were very satisfied with the quality, cleanness and service.”
Reviews.Author: postboxWennigsen
Reviews.Content: We were the first time in rome and were surprised about the readiness of personnell at the reception to inform us about the the travelling by bus and railways for sightseeing. We got every help from the reception to find the best way to the objects of interest . The quality of the buffet and breakfast was very good. The breakfast should be a little bit more continental style. Cleanness and quality of funiture was very good.No other points for improvement.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent quiet friendly hotel in the...”
Reviews.Author: Jerry1919
Reviews.Content: Excellent quiet friendly hotel in the roman suburbs - very clean with modern fittings -extremely helpful staff with good language skills- as long as you are aware of 40 min journey (1€) to centre and last train times u can't go wrong - highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and good value hotel for visiting Rome.”
Reviews.Author: gorab
Reviews.Content: We searched for a good but not very expensive hotel in Rome. We arrived at 7 PM after spending whole day in the center of Rome. Lady at the reception welcomed us with a smile. Frankly speaking every day of our stay service was very nice and helpful. Room we got, was not very big but comfortable and quiet during nights if there are not guests who do parties in the near rooms. The things we were lack of in the room was free water bottles and things to prepare a tea or coffee (2 Euros for a tea in the hotel bar!). Bathrooms are very clean, they can satisfy the greatest aesthete. Hotel is located quite far from a center but don`t worry. With a good planning a journey from the center to hotel takes about 45 min and costs 1 Euro/person! The best is to take metro to Valle Aurelia, next train FR3 to La Giustiniana and next bus 322 or 201 to hotel (not sure the numbers). Don`t travel by bus because you will be stopping on countless stops. The advantage is the hotel provides free shuttle to La Guistiniana. As for breakfasts they are tasty and big enough to provide a supply of energy for visiting Rome. But they are the same every day. Lack of hot meals like sausages, eggs etc. Lack of coffee, tea pots. Every hot drink you have to order. Is not a problem when there are few guests but with more it can become. I don't know much about surroundings. Man from the hotel told us about good restaurant near but we didn't check it because we spent whole day in the center. I didn't notice any shops near either. In conclusion: very good and comfortable hotel for good value (we paid about 70 Euros per day for a room, in the center 100 Euros/room, some without breakfast).

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel for a cheap price - and very friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: JUS67
Reviews.Content: Nice three days / two nights in Rome. Good hotel for a good price - and a big thanks to a very friendly staff behind the counter. The hotel is not in the centre of rome - you have to travel for a while - but it's ok. If we come back to rome, we will take again this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Roma”
Reviews.Author: Ann60NewYork
Reviews.Content: This is a very good hotel to stay and we have been very happy there. It was also great value for what we spent. The people have treated us very well providing all sort of services and information you expect from 4 * hotel. Not the most central place in Rome but the area is very quite. Surely looking to stay there if we are back to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, but a bit far out from the centre of Rome.”
Reviews.Author: Sisterfliss
Reviews.Content: The staff at Veio Park are very helpful and willing to take the time to help you with any queries. The hotel is about a 10-15 minute walk from the local train station, but if you leave the hotel before 10am then one of the staff will drive you. The location is about a 30 minute train ride from the centre of Rome so once you've left your hotel in the morning, you're out for the whole day. There are a couple of restaurants nearby and a the hotel has a deal with one or two so you can have a discount off your meal. The rooms are comfortable and clean. Breakfast down in the restaurant is continental with plenty of choice. Although this is a 3* hotel, it's really nice and at the upper end of 3* ness.

Reviews.Title: “great place. great value. great staff”
Reviews.Author: MariaA
Reviews.Content: in agreement with many of the other positive reviews posted, it was a very pleasant stay. the staff were very hospitable, helpful and friendly. the rooms were clean and the breakfast was good (not fantastic, but good enough). the location was a bit of a long jouney into the centre of rome, but simple and easy. overall, would definitely recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful base for touring in Rome”
Reviews.Author: murraba
Reviews.Content: We were thoroughly pleased by the facilities, amenities, and staff at Veio Park Hotel. We visited from Dec. 26, 2009, to Jan. 2, 2010. The hotel is situated in a suburban area northwest of Rome with lots of open countryside. We felt quite safe walking in the neighborhood (other than the normal danger of recklessly enthusiastic Italian drivers). There are restaurants, pizzerias (2 with delivery), a supermarket, and an electronics store nearby. The latter proved a good place to buy an adaptor (10 euros) for using our US electrical devises. This is a critical piece of equipment for American travelers in Europe. They can handle the 220 voltage, but our straight-pronged plugs won't fit into round-pronged outlets in Europe. By walking or catching the bus just outside the hotel, we could catch a train about half a mile away that will take us into Rome and connect us with the metro for an economical 1 euro per 75-minute trip. The cost of the train to the Fiumicino Airport, a little over an hour away, is only 5.50 euros. A car from the hotel will also run you over to the train station for free between 8:00 and10:00 AM. Our room was a comfortable size and spotlessly clean with a firm, comfortable bed, flat-screen TV, and minibar. The bathroom was very modern with an excellent shower and a bidet. All equipment was in perfect working order and the water was hot. We could open the windows onto a pleasant courtyard with palm trees and onto the lovely countryside. Roman winters are quite mild (usually in the 50s), but come prepared for some rain. The hotel provides an excellent breakfast with an assortment of sliced meat and cheeses, pastries, breads, cereal, milk, fruit, and yogurt. The staff makes coffee to order and delivers it to your table. The hotel desk is staffed 24 hours a day. We enjoyed fast, free internet wireless service, allowing us to post daily pictures to friends back home. Probably the single best thing about Veio Park Hotel is the friendly, helpful staff. The desk clerks all speak fairly good English, and they tirelessly answered my questions. They provided maps and transportation information for our daily excursions into the city. They also researched sites on the internet for us and made reservations. Everyone we saw on the staff greeted us and attended promptly to any requests. One clerk showed us how we could catch a night bus back from the Colosseum area on New Year's Eve after the trains stopped running at 10:30. However, it rained that evening and we decided not to venture out. The next day she was very worried about us, for she learned that the bus had been canceled without notice. She was visibly relieved to learn that we had not been stranded in downtown Rome. We felt lucky to have avoided an expensive taxi bill, but also impressed by her personal concern for our welfare. If we return to vacation in Rome, this will clearly be our first choice for accommodations, and we highly recommend it to readers of Trip Advisor.

Reviews.Title: “A Very Recommanded hotel.”
Reviews.Author: GalMarina
Reviews.Content: VeioPark hotel had to impress me a lot for I expected it to be perfect: according to these woderful reviews it had. TY TripAdvisor:-) It had. The hotel is the cleanEST I have ever seen both in its design and rooms, the baths are luxuries [you do not expect 3* to be the Ritz accomadation] and has all the little thigns we like to use. All facilities are included. Price is more than fair. Buffet is great. Personel is very kind. ok, Location is 40m far from Rome, but in a 1EUR ticket you get there. If you are old and cranky, if you do not like the 40m\1EUR train, do not use the hotel. What amazed us most was room service. It was wonderful. They [If I knew their names] folded our pijamas and formed my wifes sweaters in a human form. This kind of service I have never seen. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place to stay if you go to Rome”
Reviews.Author: RioGlobetrotter
Reviews.Content: Althought a little bit far from the center of Rome, about 40 min, because the train is always late, it's easy and not expensive to get there, with 1 euro a ticket that you can buy at the hotel reception you can take the bus in front of the hotel or just walk to the train station, about 15 minutes walk. There you take the train that commutes to metro Rome system. It sounds difficult but it is not and the very gentle and polite staff of the hotel will explain everything to you. Also they will recommend and even give you a discount cuppon for a restaurant just beside the train station, don't loose this one, it's great! The breakfast is very good and the staff also, so everything compensates in far the distance. If you decide to stay in Rome Center you will probably pay twice or even three times the value for a lousy room. I realfy recommend the Veio Park and I would for sure stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “kind-clean-silence-good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: adisilvi
Reviews.Content: Veio Park Hotel provided good value for money. The room was clean and comfortable, showers were working properly and the air conditioner was silent and in perfect health. The staff was also quite helpful with respect to providing guidance for our itinerary. I little bit far from the center but subways were easy. Very thinn waals. You hear everything.

Reviews.Title: “Outside the City”
Reviews.Author: happy_trails_2_you99
Reviews.Content: The location was really the only down-side to this hotel. It is at least a quarter mile walk to the nearest restaurant and the train station. However, we didn't mind, and the local restaurants were pretty decent. If you don't mind waiting, the bus stops almost right in front of the hotel. In the morning, an employee was driving guests to the train station so they wouldn't have to walk, which was unexpected and nice. The hotel was updated, clean, comfortable and quiet. If you are looking for nightlife, I would NOT recommend this hotel, but if you are looking for a clean, quiet stay it is great.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, quiet hotel, great service, but long trip to center.”
Reviews.Author: buzi19
Reviews.Content: The hotel is away from the craziness in Rome, but the English speaking staff provided maps, directions, weather information, and answered any of our questions. The rooms are very clean and modern, breakfast room is beautiful. However, it is a 15 minute walk to the train station ( prefferable than waiting on the bus which gets stuck in traffic), then ride the train for about 6 stops, then transfer onto the metro which is very well organized and can take you to any major tourist attraction. So after a long day of walking in Rome, it was tiring to get to the hotel, but still worth it because of its serenity.

Reviews.Title: “Best rooms and value....far from center”
Reviews.Author: VillaCoralowner
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a GREAT value for those who want to save their money for culture & food. The rooms were the best we experienced in Italy during our 2 week visit. Everything was spotless and completely new. We really relaxed when we were there. It took us 45 min. to 1 hour to reach the city center using the trains....so once you leave in the morning you have to plan your day. It's recommended that you eat dinner in town before returning since the closest restaurants are about 15 min. walking along a major avenue. The walk was a bit stressful so we did it only once. If you stay out in Rome late, keep in mind that the last train returning is at 10pm so you will need a taxi after that time. Taxis cost between 20-30 euros. The down side really is the fact that the front desk ladies could be more welcoming and could explain the amenities a bit more thoroughly. No one told us about the free shuttle service to the train station in the mornings from 8-10. I knew because I read it in a review. I got the feeling they really don't want everyone to know about this. Also, their phone number was incorrect and I was not able to reach them once in Europe. There were no taxis at the train station so we walked about 1 mile through the busy avenue with luggage to reach the hotel. Overall, I think they could be friendlier and give a brief orientation to tourists upon arrival. That small detail could have transformed our good stay to a wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: HHarry044
Reviews.Content: Dear Sir, madam, Once more we would like to thank you for the wonderful stay we experienced at your hotel last week. When asked for a review we will certainly give your hotel the highest marks possible. Rooms, facilities and most of all the good service we got from all staff members was excellent. We will recommend your hotel to our friends, relatives and business associates. Thank you once again. With kindest regards, Mr. and Mrs. E.R. Schijf Mr. and Mrs. S.A Hiemstra

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings.”
Reviews.Author: Invinceyble
Reviews.Content: We had read all the reviews before we chose this hotel, and, surprisingly enough, despite being opposite they are all true! So yes, the staff were very friendly, yes, the room was well equipped and very nice&clean (especially the bathroom), yes, the food was excellent, BUT at the same time the walls must have been made of cardboard (you could literally hear what your neighbours were discussing - not that I wanted to of course), at the reception where you had to leave the room key before leaving I could have just given somebody else's room number and I would have been given their key no questions asked (there was a safe in the room for valuables but still), and last but not least, the hotel is really too far away from the city center (around 50 minutes away, one way by trains&metro). One more thing, we barely spent any time in the hotel room apart from nights and did not even use amenities like TV, bar etc. and they tried to charge us for a CHOCOLATE BAR that allegedly disappeared from the fridge? We didn't even open the goddamn thing, hello? All in all, if you don't mind wasting time to get to the city center and being able to hear a mosquito fart from the adjacent room, then Veio Park Hotel is really great and good value for money. Personally, next time we go to Rome we will try and get a place closer to the city center.

Reviews.Title: “feeling welcome”
Reviews.Author: moelotz
Reviews.Content: The stay in the hotel was awsome. As a flight attendant I see a lot of high class hotels and also know their service. In the Veio Park Hotel was a very warm and welcoming atmosphere. The people at the front desk, housekeeping and the waiters while we had our breakfast were all friendly, open minded and flfiled all our wishes. Thank you very much for that great stay in Rome. FAMILY LOTZ

Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem in the suburbs of Rome”
Reviews.Author: Ozjamboree
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights at this hotel in September and loved this hotel. The rooms were comfortable but of a reasonable size. Some noise could be heard from other rooms at times but this is a common experience in European hotels. Breakfast was excellent and the staff very obliging and friendly. This hotel is some distance from the centre of Rome and it took between 40 mins and an hour to reach the centre of Rome. A pleasant stay overall.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away, bad service and rooms are not soundproof!!”
Reviews.Author: zsilvereyes2
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because of all the nice reviews I saw. I am not sure who is writing the nice reviews but this place is very very noisy. You can hear the person using the bathroom in the next room and hear every little coversations!! The doors do not shut all the way. You have to give your key when you go and come so anyone can get in your room. You can tell them a room number and they just give you a key. I spoke with the manager about a problem that i encountered with the receptionist. When all said and done, they did nothing and said it was a misunderstanding!!! We talked with another couple staying here and they said the same thing, very very noisy!! Avoid this place if you can. Not worth the money!!

Reviews.Title: “For value and quality you won't find better in Rome”
Reviews.Author: harbincity
Reviews.Content: Clean rooms, friendly staff, good breakfast. No complaints even if a little out of the way for travel to Rome. Slight drawback is no restaurant but a couple nearby and a supermarket within 5 minutes walk left or right of the hotel. Station is 20 minutes walk away but the hotel manager took us there every day. Just had to walk back or catch the bus (201 or 223). A bit of a nuisance having to change trains (at Valle Aurelio) but not really a problem. (still 1 euro pp each way). We did the hop on/hop off bus tour with a 2 day ticket, enjoyed the sights but would NOT use the City Tour buses again, supposed to be every 15 minutes but often 25 and even 35 on one occasion. Roma Christiana or 110 Open would have been better bets. Trip to/from Fiumicino airport approx 90 minutes from hotel, 2 trains (change at Testevere), 6.5 euros pp each way.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel...A bit far out”
Reviews.Author: Yesman78
Reviews.Content: After our wedding in Pozzili went up to Rome for a couple of days.Picked this hotel as I had a car and didnt want to drive into the middle of Rome.The ringroad around Rome was a nightmare,so poorly signposted.The hotel itself was modern,but tastefully done.The breakfasts very very good.The only downside was it was a good 20 minute walk to the station,I know I picked a hotel on the edge of Rome,but it was a hike to get any transport into the centre.

Reviews.Title: “best hotel experience in europe”
Reviews.Author: joonbug09
Reviews.Content: The staff were the best in europe. Friendliest, always looking to help us in any way possible. I would recommend this hotel to anyone. Will be back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “thanks for your kindnes and good service”
Reviews.Author: rowida
Reviews.Content: your staff is exelent,very frindly and helpfull. The rooms are nice modern and very clean, good ventilated. Thanks for your kindnes and good service. Roel Koopmans

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel as starting point for your Rome visit”
Reviews.Author: powertools1
Reviews.Content: we enjoyed our stay @ Veio park hotel early July 2009. the rooms are spacious and very well equipped and the breakfast was also very good. The front-desk is very professional and speaks very good english. When you come to Rome for a short city trip like we did, there is ample info from the front desk where to go and how to come around in Rome. The hotel itself is approx 20 km from the city center which can easilly be reached by public transport in about 30 min. tickets available at the front-desk. (1 euro / person, valid for 75 minutes) all in all an very good experience at an affordable price.

Reviews.Title: “Mr. and Mrs Raul Reyes”
Reviews.Author: reyesraul66
Reviews.Content: Hi; I don't quite understand all that the form questions ask as I don't speak or write Italian. However, I was absolutely satisfied with all of your Hotel accommodations. If I were to rate the hotel in terms of stars, I would rate it as a four star hotel. I will certainly recommend it to all my friends and I will mention the prime location that the hotel is in, easy access to the railway, bus lines and fine restaurants in the area to include your restaurant, of course. If I'm ever in the area and I need to stay at a hotel, I will certainly consider you establishment as my FIRST CHOICE. Hope to see you soon again. If you wish you may send me the questionnaire in English. Sincerely, Mr. and Mrs Raul Reyes

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, a little far away”
Reviews.Author: Moonthief
Reviews.Content: To make it short, this hotel has a lot to offer, good, well cleaned rooms, a great breakfast buffet (but call the waiter to get your coffee, they will not ask you) and friendly, helpful staff. On the bad side, its more than 700 m to the trainstation, from where you need to travel around 30 minutes to get even close to the city center.

Reviews.Title: “Can't fault it”
Reviews.Author: Molto80
Reviews.Content: This hotel isn't really in Rome, but rather in a village called La Giustiniana, about 10km to the North. Location is not a problem however, as you can ride the train to the city (the receptionists will give you all the details you need) or even drive there if Italian drivers don't scare you. The price we paid was very reasonable. The staff were friendly and very helpful and the room was clean, quiet and modern. Breakfast was also good. I'd definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “What a lil gem!”
Reviews.Author: PackYourBagsToday
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Veio Park Hotel for a week; The staff were professional and friendly. My room was very clean with housekeeping doing a good job of being on top of things. The tasty breakfast in the morning gets your day off to a great start. The 20-30 minutes commute into the city is an non-issue as far as I'm concerned because there's no way that you would get the great value (price, qualify service, fabulous rooms) that Veio Park offers from a hotel in the city. I will absolutely stay at the Veio Park Hotel when I next visit Rome.

HotelInfo.Name: Veio Park Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Via Cassia 1171 G, 1189 Rome, Italy
